title: G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L)
description: Obtain excellent results in the G.C.E. A/L, preferably in the Maths or Arts stream with a focus on subjects that develop spatial awareness and creativity. You must pass a separate aptitude test for admission to university architecture programs.
qualifications: Pass in University Aptitude Test for Architecture

title: Bachelor of Science (B.Sc.) in Architecture
description: Complete a 3-year B.Sc. in Architecture. This degree provides the foundational knowledge of architectural design, history, theory, and technology. This qualification is equivalent to the SLIA Part 1 professional examination.

title: Year-Out Experience & Master's Degree
description: Work for at least one year as an architectural assistant under a Chartered Architect. Following this, enroll in a 2-year Master of Science (M.Sc.) in Architecture program, which is equivalent to the SLIA Part 2 examination.

title: Obtain Charter - Become a Chartered Architect
description: After your Master's, you need another year of practical experience. Then, you must pass the Sri Lanka Institute of Architects (SLIA) Part 3 Professional Practice Examination to obtain your charter and the license to practice.
qualifications: AIA (SL) - Associate of the Sri Lanka Institute of Architects

title: Senior Architect / Own Practice
description: With your charter and several years of experience, you can lead large-scale projects as a Senior Architect or establish your own architectural firm. Continuous professional development is key to staying relevant.
